content: below beginning at the juncture between the 1st and 2nd dpns 1 needle 2 k1 wt p1 needle 1 p1 wt k1 2 needle 2 k2 wt p2 needle 1 p2 wt k2 3 needle 2 k3 wt k3 needle 1 p3 wt k3 ~ 3 ~ continue in this manner increasing the number of stitches to knit/purl by one on each short row until all of the sts except the first one on needles 1 and 2 have been wrapped once this includes the 6 sts on needle 3 knit across needles 2 and 3 then work the following rounds on all three dpns 1 k1 k2tog repeat to end switch to orange yarn at this point if knitting a white goose 2-4 k all sts 5 k2 k2tog repeat to end 6-7 k all sts 8 k1 k2tog repeat to end 9-11 k all sts cut yarn thread it into a darning needle and thread through the remaining live sts removing dpns as you go secure end flatten out the bill stuff the head neck and front half of body very firmly tail place the 30 sts from scrap yarn back onto 3 dpns 10 sts on each work the following rounds 1 k2tog k3 repeat to end 2-4 k all sts k only 1 round for white goose 5 k2tog k2 repeat to end 6-8 k all sts k only 1 round for white goose switch to black yarn 9-10 canada goose only k all sts at this point you will finish stuffing the body firmly the tail will not be stuffed at all 11 k2tog k1 repeat to end 12-13 k all sts 14 k2tog k2 repeat to end 15-16 k all sts 17 k2tog k1 repeat to end 18-19 k all sts cut yarn thread it into a darning needle and thread through the remaining live sts removing dpns as you go secure end flatten out the tail ~ 4 ~ legs and feet with black yarn co 9 sts onto 3 dpns 3 on each and work the following rounds 1-3 k all sts 4 k1 k2tog repeat to end k all sts for 1 inch then work the following rounds 1 m1 k2 repeat to end 2 k all sts 3 m1 k3 repeat to end 4 k all sts divide all sts onto two dpns 6 on each 5 ssk k2 k2tog repeat on 2nd dpn 6 ssk k2tog repeat on 2nd dpn 7 k all sts 8 k2tog repeat on 2nd dpn cut yarn thread it into a darning needle and thread through the remaining live sts removing dpns as you go secure flatten out the foot with the help of a knitting needle stuff legs not feet and insert a wooden match or other straight stick down through the open end this is to stabilize the leg and help support your goose when he is sitting seam the open end of each leg to the middle of your goose s
